p:
The crude extract and fractions of S. glaucus were screened for antioxidative activity using 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) as described by Brand et al. [ 21]. In brief, 500 μL of each sample at various concentrations from each fraction was mixed with 125 μL DPPH solution (1 mM) and 375 μL methanol and further incubated for 30 min. Finally, UV-spectrophotometer absorbance measurement at λ = 517 nm was applied to demonstrate the anti-DPPH activity using the following formula:
(1)
% of antiradical activity =
Abs of control − Abs of sample
Abs of control × 100
.
